description: Range elements are filtering syntax used after the 'range' keyword in PFC commands. They select subsets of objects (balls, walls, contacts, etc.) based on geometric regions, attributes, or logical conditions.

examples: contact property fric 0.5 range cylinder end-1 0 0 0 end-2 0 0 10 radius 5
notes: Multiple range elements create intersection (AND) by default
Unspecified range affects all objects of target type

attribute.name: Attribute Elements
attribute.description: Select objects by ID, group, or other attributes

pfc_specific.description: Elements specific to PFC (balls, walls, contacts)

common_patterns.name: Set property by group
common_patterns.description: Set density for balls in group

common_patterns.name: Cylindrical confining
common_patterns.example: wall attribute velocity (0.001,0,0) range cylinder end-1 0 0 0 end-2 0 0 10 radius 5
common_patterns.description: Set wall velocity in cylindrical region

common_patterns.name: Exclude boundary
common_patterns.example: ball fix velocity range group 'boundary' not
common_patterns.description: Fix all balls except boundary group

common_patterns.name: Named range reuse
common_patterns.example:
model range create 'core' cylinder end-1 0 0 0 end-2 0 0 10 radius 3
ball attribute density 2500 range named-range 'core'

notes: Multiple range elements create intersection (AND) by default
Unspecified range affects all objects of target type
